items.title: Hezbollah chief of staff killed in Beirut airstrike, Israeli military says
items.standfirst: Militant group confirms Haytham Ali Tabatabai was killed in attack that dramatically escalates tensions in the regionIsrael targeted one of Hezbollah’s most senior military commanders in an airstrike in Beirut’s southern suburbs on Sunday, dramatically escalating tensions with the group almost exactly a year after a ceasefire ended 14 months of clashes.The Israeli military said several hours after the attack that Haytham Ali Tabatabai, Hezbollah’s chief of staff, was killed in the strike in Lebanese capital. Continue reading...

items.title: Israel kills top Hezbollah official in first attack on Beirut in months
items.standfirst: Israel has escalated its campaign on targets it says are linked to Hezbollah, raising fears of a resumption of hostilities.
items.content: Israel has escalated its campaign on targets it says are linked to Hezbollah, raising fears of a resumption of hostilities.

items.title: Israel attacks Beirut suburb two days after Lebanon agreed for talks
items.standfirst: Israel kills top Hezbollah commander only two days after Lebanon's president said he was open to negotiations.
items.content: Israel kills top Hezbollah commander only two days after Lebanon's president said he was open to negotiations.

items.title: 'Haytham Ali Tabtabai had been wanted by both the US and Israel for years'
items.standfirst: Israel killed militant group Hezbollah's top military official in an airstrike on a southern suburb of Beirut on Sunday, the Israeli military said, despite a US-brokered truce a year ago. "Haytham Ali Tabtabai had been wanted by both the US and Israel for years," said FRANCE 24's correspondent in Beirut, Lebanon, Rawad Taha.
items.content: Israel killed militant group Hezbollah's top military official in an airstrike on a southern suburb of Beirut on Sunday, the Israeli military said, despite a US-brokered truce a year ago. "Haytham Ali Tabtabai had been wanted by both the US and Israel for years," said FRANCE 24's correspondent in Beirut, Lebanon, Rawad Taha.

items.title: Israel kills a senior Hezbollah official in Beirut strike
items.standfirst: Israel killed Hezbollah's chief of staff in an air strike on the southern suburbs of Beirut, Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's office said on Sunday. Lebanese officials said the air strike killed at least five people and wounded 28 more.
items.content: Israel killed Hezbollah's chief of staff in an air strike on the southern suburbs of Beirut, Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's office said on Sunday. Lebanese officials said the air strike killed at least five people and wounded 28 more.

items.content: An Israeli airstrike has struck Lebanon's capital Beirut for the first time in months, killing Hezbollah's chief of staff.

items.title: Israel kills top Hezbollah commander in attack on Lebanon’s capital

items.content: Hezbollah confirms death of 'great commander' Haytham Ali Tabatabai, says attacks 'open door to escalation of assaults'.

ai_summary: Israel killed a senior Hezbollah official in Beirut, escalating tensions.
The strike was the first Israeli attack on Beirut in months.
Hezbollah confirmed the death of Haytham Ali Tabatabai, a senior commander.
The attack occurred two days after Lebanon expressed openness to talks.
The US and Israel had previously sought Tabatabai for years.

clusters.title: US hails 'tremendous progress' at Ukraine peace talks

items.title: US hails 'tremendous progress' at Ukraine peace talks
items.standfirst: Secretary of State Marco Rubio says more work is needed to finalise a US-Ukraine deal that will then need Russia's agreement.
items.content: Secretary of State Marco Rubio says more work is needed to finalise a US-Ukraine deal that will then need Russia's agreement.

items.title: U.S. lawmakers, allies voice concern over Trump’s Ukraine peace proposal
items.standfirst: Secretary of State Marco Rubio traveled to Switzerland for meetings with Ukrainian and European officials on Sunday as U.S. efforts to coordinate a Ukraine peace plan were clouded by concerns over the origins of the proposal from both U.S. lawmakers, along with European allies. NBC News’ Molly Hunter reports.
items.content: Secretary of State Marco Rubio traveled to Switzerland for meetings with Ukrainian and European officials on Sunday as U.S. efforts to coordinate a Ukraine peace plan were clouded by concerns over the origins of the proposal from both U.S. lawmakers, along with European allies. NBC News’ Molly Hunter reports.

items.title: Officials meet in Geneva for Ukraine talks as peace plan’s author called into question
items.standfirst: In Geneva on Sunday, U.S. officials put the heat on Ukraine to accept a peace deal to end the war with Russia or else. The author of the plan became a point of contention, while President Donald Trump said Ukrainian leadership had expressed “zero gratitude” for American efforts. Nick Schifrin…
items.content: In Geneva on Sunday, U.S. officials put the heat on Ukraine to accept a peace deal to end the war with Russia or else. The author of the plan became a point of contention, while President Donald Trump said Ukrainian leadership had expressed “zero gratitude” for American efforts. Nick Schifrin…

items.title: US and Ukraine announce ‘updated’ framework to end Russia’s war
items.standfirst: Rubio says 'tremendous' progress made in meetings with Ukrainian and European officials on proposal to halt the war.
items.content: Rubio says 'tremendous' progress made in meetings with Ukrainian and European officials on proposal to halt the war.

items.title: 'The Ukrainians haven't said anything concrete about what has been changed in the plan'
items.standfirst: US Secretary of State Marco Rubio boasted "tremendous" progress after a day of meetings with Ukrainian and European officials in Geneva on a proposal to halt the Ukraine war, but numerous uncertainties remain. "The Ukrainians haven't said anything concrete about what has been changed in the plan, nor did Rubio [ . . .] Clearly the Ukrainians are in a very difficult position," said FRANCE 24's correspondent in Kyiv, Ukraine Gulliver Cragg.
items.content: US Secretary of State Marco Rubio boasted "tremendous" progress after a day of meetings with Ukrainian and European officials in Geneva on a proposal to halt the Ukraine war, but numerous uncertainties remain. "The Ukrainians haven't said anything concrete about what has been changed in the plan, nor did Rubio [ . . .] Clearly the Ukrainians are in a very difficult position," said FRANCE 24's correspondent in Kyiv, Ukraine Gulliver Cragg.

items.title: US hails 'tremendous progress' on Ukraine peace plan - but says negotiators 'need more time'
items.standfirst: The US secretary of state has hailed a "tremendous amount of progress" on peace talks after the US and Ukraine delegations met in Geneva - but said that negotiators would "need more time".
items.content: The US secretary of state has hailed a "tremendous amount of progress" on peace talks after the US and Ukraine delegations met in Geneva - but said that negotiators would "need more time".

items.title: Zelensky thanks Trump as US leader accuses Ukraine of showing 'zero gratitude'
items.standfirst: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky sought to win back US President Donald Trump's favour on Sunday, after the US leader slammed Kyiv amid crucial talks in Geneva to end the war with Russia.
items.content: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky sought to win back US President Donald Trump's favour on Sunday, after the US leader slammed Kyiv amid crucial talks in Geneva to end the war with Russia.

items.title: US-Ukraine talks: Why are European leaders opposing Trump’s peace plan?
items.standfirst: Officials from the US, EU and Ukraine meet in Geneva to discuss Donald Trump's plan to end Russia's war with Ukraine.
items.content: Officials from the US, EU and Ukraine meet in Geneva to discuss Donald Trump's plan to end Russia's war with Ukraine.

items.title: Ukraine-Russia peace talks under way as US insists it authored peace plan
items.standfirst: Fresh talks on the future of the war in Ukraine are underway in Geneva, with delegations from the US, Ukraine, and European allies participating. Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky said that “diplomacy has been activated” and expressed hope that the meetings would be constructive. The talks follow criticism from Western leaders of a 28-point peace plan promoted by US President Donald Trump, widely seen as favouring Russia. France24 correspondent Emmanuelle Chaze reports the latest from Kyiv, Ukraine.
items.content: Fresh talks on the future of the war in Ukraine are underway in Geneva, with delegations from the US, Ukraine, and European allies participating. Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky said that “diplomacy has been activated” and expressed hope that the meetings would be constructive. The talks follow criticism from Western leaders of a 28-point peace plan promoted by US President Donald Trump, widely seen as favouring Russia. France24 correspondent Emmanuelle Chaze reports the latest from Kyiv, Ukraine.

items.title: U.S. and Ukraine hold talks as lawmakers and allies voice concern over Russian 'wish list'
items.standfirst: Secretary of State Marco Rubio has landed in Switzerland for meetings with Ukrainian and European leaders on Sunday.
items.content: Secretary of State Marco Rubio has landed in Switzerland for meetings with Ukrainian and European leaders on Sunday.

ai_summary: The US Secretary of State, Marco Rubio, reported significant progress in Geneva.
Meetings involved Ukrainian and European officials discussing a peace plan.
Concerns arose over the origins of the peace proposal.
The Ukrainians have not specified changes to the plan.
Negotiators indicated that more time is needed to finalize the deal.

items.content: Brazil's former president Jair Bolsonaro has said "hallucinations" and a nervous breakdown led to an attempt to tamper with his electronic ankle tag.

items.title: Bolsonaro says hallucinatory effects of meds made him tamper with ankle tag
items.standfirst: Brazil's ex-president, convicted of foiled coup, is under arrest after taking a soldering iron to the monitoring device.
items.content: Brazil's ex-president, convicted of foiled coup, is under arrest after taking a soldering iron to the monitoring device.

items.title: Jair Bolsonaro claims ‘psychotic attack’ made him tamper with ankle monitor
items.standfirst: Brazil’s former president says he took a soldering iron to electronic tag as he was hallucinating that it was buggedBrazil’s far-right former president Jair Bolsonaro has claimed he took a soldering iron to his electronic ankle monitor after having a substance-induced “psychotic attack” that caused him to hallucinate that the device was bugged.Bolsonaro made the claim during a custody hearing on Sunday, 24 hours after he was arrested at his home in the capital, Brasília, amid suspicions he was planning to abscond to a foreign embassy to avoid being sent to jail to serve a 27-year sentence for masterminding a failed coup. Continue reading...
items.content: Brazil’s former president says he took a soldering iron to electronic tag as he was hallucinating that it was buggedBrazil’s far-right former president Jair Bolsonaro has claimed he took a soldering iron to his electronic ankle monitor after having a substance-induced “psychotic attack” that caused him to hallucinate that the device was bugged.Bolsonaro made the claim during a custody hearing on Sunday, 24 hours after he was arrested at his home in the capital, Brasília, amid suspicions he was planning to abscond to a foreign embassy to avoid being sent to jail to serve a 27-year sentence for masterminding a failed coup. Continue reading...

items.title: Jair Bolsonaro arrested after tampering with ankle tag ‘out of curiosity’
items.standfirst: Brazilian ex-president says he used soldering iron on device and is now in custody over fears he was going to abscondBrazil’s former far-right president Jair Bolsonaro has claimed he tried to damage his electronic ankle monitor “out of curiosity” after he was arrested at his villa owing to suspicions he was poised to abscond.In a video released by the supreme court, Bolsonaro – who was recently sentenced to 27 years in prison for masterminding a military coup – can be heard admitting to a security official that he had used a soldering iron to tamper with the black tag. Continue reading...
items.content: Brazilian ex-president says he used soldering iron on device and is now in custody over fears he was going to abscondBrazil’s former far-right president Jair Bolsonaro has claimed he tried to damage his electronic ankle monitor “out of curiosity” after he was arrested at his villa owing to suspicions he was poised to abscond.In a video released by the supreme court, Bolsonaro – who was recently sentenced to 27 years in prison for masterminding a military coup – can be heard admitting to a security official that he had used a soldering iron to tamper with the black tag. Continue reading...

ai_summary: Jair Bolsonaro claimed "hallucinations" caused him to tamper with his ankle monitor.
He stated he was experiencing a "psychotic attack" due to medication.
Bolsonaro was arrested after using a soldering iron on the device.
He was under house arrest after being convicted of a foiled coup.
Bolsonaro said he thought the device was bugged.

clusters.title: News Wrap: Israel hits Beirut with deadly strike targeting a Hezbollah leader
clusters.neutral_headline: Schoolchildren Escape Kidnapping in Nigeria

items.title: News Wrap: Israel hits Beirut with deadly strike targeting a Hezbollah leader
items.standfirst: In our news wrap Sunday, Israel carried out an airstrike in Beirut nearly a year after it agreed to a ceasefire with Hezbollah, 50 of the 303 children kidnapped from a Catholic school in Nigeria escaped and reunited with their families, the G20 summit in South Africa ended with little fanfare…
items.content: In our news wrap Sunday, Israel carried out an airstrike in Beirut nearly a year after it agreed to a ceasefire with Hezbollah, 50 of the 303 children kidnapped from a Catholic school in Nigeria escaped and reunited with their families, the G20 summit in South Africa ended with little fanfare…

items.title: 'The Nigerian government has decided to close all schools in the region'
items.standfirst: Fifty of the more han 300 students kidnapped from a Nigerian Catholic school last week have escaped and have been reunited with their parents, the Catholic Church and Christian Association of Nigeria (CAN) said on Sunday. While waiting for more information, the Nigerian government has decided to close all schools in the region.
items.content: Fifty of the more han 300 students kidnapped from a Nigerian Catholic school last week have escaped and have been reunited with their parents, the Catholic Church and Christian Association of Nigeria (CAN) said on Sunday. While waiting for more information, the Nigerian government has decided to close all schools in the region.

items.title: Fifty schoolchildren escape kidnappers in Nigeria, more than 250 remain captive
items.standfirst: Fifty of the more than 300 children kidnapped by gunmen from a Catholic school in Niger state managed to escape their captors and have reunited with their families, a Christian group affiliated with the school said on Sunday. Armed attackers on Friday took 303 children and 12 teachers captive in one of Nigeria's largest mass kidnappings to date.
items.content: Fifty of the more than 300 children kidnapped by gunmen from a Catholic school in Niger state managed to escape their captors and have reunited with their families, a Christian group affiliated with the school said on Sunday. Armed attackers on Friday took 303 children and 12 teachers captive in one of Nigeria's largest mass kidnappings to date.

items.title: 50 schoolchildren escape captivity in Nigeria, more than 200 still held
items.standfirst: Fifty of the 303 schoolchildren abducted from a Catholic school in Nigeria's Niger state have escaped and are now with their families.
items.content: Fifty of the 303 schoolchildren abducted from a Catholic school in Nigeria's Niger state have escaped and are now with their families.(Image credit: Sunday Alamba)

items.title: Dozens of kidnapped schoolchildren escape as Pope Leo appeals for release of remaining abductees
items.standfirst: At least 50 of the 303 children abducted this week from a Catholic school in Nigeria have escaped and been reunited with their families, a church group has said, as Pope Leo pleaded for their immediate release.
items.content: At least 50 of the 303 children abducted this week from a Catholic school in Nigeria have escaped and been reunited with their families, a church group has said, as Pope Leo pleaded for their immediate release.

items.title: Security fears rise in Nigeria after more than 300 schoolchildren kidnapped
items.standfirst: Christian group revises up number of students and teachers missing after one of country’s largest mass abductionGunmen have kidnapped more than 300 students and teachers in one of the largest mass kidnappings in Nigeria, a Christian group said on Saturday, as security fears mounted in Africa’s most populous nation.The early Friday raid on St Mary’s co-educational school in Niger state in western Nigeria came after gunmen on Monday stormed a secondary school in neighbouring Kebbi state, abducting 25 girls. Continue reading...
items.content: Christian group revises up number of students and teachers missing after one of country’s largest mass abductionGunmen have kidnapped more than 300 students and teachers in one of the largest mass kidnappings in Nigeria, a Christian group said on Saturday, as security fears mounted in Africa’s most populous nation.The early Friday raid on St Mary’s co-educational school in Niger state in western Nigeria came after gunmen on Monday stormed a secondary school in neighbouring Kebbi state, abducting 25 girls. Continue reading...

ai_summary: Fifty schoolchildren escaped from kidnappers in Nigeria.
Over 250 children remain captive after the mass kidnapping.
The kidnapping occurred at a Catholic school in Niger state.
The Nigerian government decided to close schools in the region.
Pope Leo appealed for the release of the remaining abductees.

items.title: Wisconsin woman in 2014 Slender Man stabbing is missing
US woman behind Slender Man stabbing is missing after leaving group home
items.standfirst: Morgan Geyser of Wisconsin cut off her electronic monitoring device and was last seen with an acquaintanceA Wisconsin woman who admitted to stabbing a classmate nearly to death in 2014 to please the online horror character Slender Man is missing after she cut off an electronic monitoring device and left a group home, authorities said on Sunday.Madison police issued an alert on Sunday for Morgan Geyser, now 23, saying she was last seen around 8pm on Saturday with an adult acquaintance. Continue reading...

items.title: Banned Bosnian Serb leader Dodik’s party wins snap presidential elections
items.standfirst: Bosnian Serb politician Sinisa Karan, the candidate backed by dismissed entity president Milorad Dodik, won Sunday’s snap election with 50.89% of the vote, preliminary results showed. His main rival, Branko Blanusa, secured 47.81%, the central electoral commission said, based on nearly 93% of polling stations counted.
items.content: Bosnian Serb politician Sinisa Karan, the candidate backed by dismissed entity president Milorad Dodik, won Sunday’s snap election with 50.89% of the vote, preliminary results showed. His main rival, Branko Blanusa, secured 47.81%, the central electoral commission said, based on nearly 93% of polling stations counted.

items.title: Barred Bosnian Serb leader Dodik’s ally wins snap presidential election
items.standfirst: Sinisa Karan wins 50.89 percent while his main rival Branko Blanusa gets 47.81 percent, preliminary results show.
items.content: Sinisa Karan wins 50.89 percent while his main rival Branko Blanusa gets 47.81 percent, preliminary results show.

ai_summary: Sinisa Karan, backed by Milorad Dodik, won the election.
Karan secured 50.89% of the vote.
His main rival, Branko Blanusa, got 47.81%.
The results are based on nearly 93% of polling stations.
The election was a snap presidential election.

clusters.title: Reeves to launch crackdown on benefit fraud alongside lifting two-child limit
clusters.neutral_headline: Reeves Plans Benefit Fraud Crackdown, Lifts Two-Child Limit

items.title: Reeves to launch crackdown on benefit fraud alongside lifting two-child limit
items.standfirst: Move aims to bring in extra £1.2bn of savings as government seeks to head off criticism over welfare spending You be the chancellor: play our budget game Rachel Reeves will launch a fresh crackdown on benefit fraud at the same time as lifting the two-child limit for universal credit at a cost of…
items.content: Move aims to bring in extra £1.2bn of savings as government seeks to head off criticism over welfare spending You be the chancellor: play our budget game Rachel Reeves will launch a fresh crackdown on benefit fraud at the same time as lifting the two-child limit for universal credit at a cost of…

items.title: Reeves to launch crackdown on benefit fraud alongside lifting two-child limit
items.standfirst: Move aims to bring in extra £1.2bn of savings as government seeks to head off criticism over welfare spendingYou be the chancellor: play our budget gameRachel Reeves will launch a fresh crackdown on benefit fraud at the same time as lifting the two-child limit for universal credit at a cost of £3bn, as ministers seek to head off criticism over rising welfare spending in the budget.The chancellor has made the decision to scrap the two-child limit in full, a move that will be welcomed by Labour MPs who have long highlighted its effect on increasing child poverty.Freezing income tax thresholds for an extra two years to 2030, bringing more people into higher tax bands as wages rise.Making salary sacrifice schemes less generous, including those for pension contributions.A pay-per-mile scheme on electric cars to help fill the tax gap from petrol duty as more people opt for green vehicles.Bringing in higher tax on the most expensive properties, including a surcharge on the highest-value houses. The surcharge will reportedly be targeted at homes worth more than £2m, after worries that a lower £1.5m threshold would hit too many in the south-east. Continue reading...
items.content: Move aims to bring in extra £1.2bn of savings as government seeks to head off criticism over welfare spendingYou be the chancellor: play our budget gameRachel Reeves will launch a fresh crackdown on benefit fraud at the same time as lifting the two-child limit for universal credit at a cost of £3bn, as ministers seek to head off criticism over rising welfare spending in the budget.The chancellor has made the decision to scrap the two-child limit in full, a move that will be welcomed by Labour MPs who have long highlighted its effect on increasing child poverty.Freezing income tax thresholds for an extra two years to 2030, bringing more people into higher tax bands as wages rise.Making salary sacrifice schemes less generous, including those for pension contributions.A pay-per-mile scheme on electric cars to help fill the tax gap from petrol duty as more people opt for green vehicles.Bringing in higher tax on the most expensive properties, including a surcharge on the highest-value houses. The surcharge will reportedly be targeted at homes worth more than £2m, after worries that a lower £1.5m threshold would hit too many in the south-east. Continue reading...

ai_summary: Rachel Reeves will launch a crackdown on benefit fraud.
The government aims to save an extra £1.2 billion.
The two-child limit for universal credit will be lifted.
Freezing income tax thresholds is planned until 2030.
Salary sacrifice schemes and high-value property taxes may change.

Continue reading...

ai_summary: A government taskforce finalized plans to speed up reactor construction.
The goal is to lower costs by streamlining UK regulations.
The taskforce was established by the prime minister in February.
The government promised to remove "archaic rules" and slash regulations.

items.title: Slovenians vote in a referendum on legalising euthanasia
items.standfirst: Slovenia’s parliament approved the legalisation of assisted suicide in July, and this Sunday, a referendum will determine whether the public supports the change. The initiative is being led by conservative parties opposed to assisted dying. Shirli Sitbon reports.
items.content: Slovenia’s parliament approved the legalisation of assisted suicide in July, and this Sunday, a referendum will determine whether the public supports the change. The initiative is being led by conservative parties opposed to assisted dying. Shirli Sitbon reports.

ai_summary: A referendum in Slovenia rejected a law on assisted dying.
The parliament had approved the law in July.
The referendum was held after the parliament's approval.
Conservative parties led the opposition to assisted dying.

items.content: The former PM is calling for more men to be screened for the disease, which is the most common cancer in males in the UK.

items.title: David Cameron reveals prostate cancer diagnosis and calls for targeted screening
items.standfirst: Former prime minister says he wants to join ranks of those pressing for more checks on men who may have disease David Cameron has disclosed he was treated for prostate cancer and has called for a targeted screening programme.The former prime minister said he had a prostate-specific antigen (PSA) test, which looks for proteins associated with the form of the disease. The result was high and he subsequently had a biopsy that revealed the cancer. Continue reading...
items.content: Former prime minister says he wants to join ranks of those pressing for more checks on men who may have disease David Cameron has disclosed he was treated for prostate cancer and has called for a targeted screening programme.The former prime minister said he had a prostate-specific antigen (PSA) test, which looks for proteins associated with the form of the disease. The result was high and he subsequently had a biopsy that revealed the cancer. Continue reading...

ai_summary: David Cameron disclosed he was treated for prostate cancer.
He is calling for more men to be screened for the disease.
He had a PSA test, which showed high protein levels.
A biopsy confirmed the presence of cancer.

items.title: Main opposition barred in Guinea-Bissau vote as President Embalo seeks second term
items.standfirst: Bissau-Guineans head to the polls on Sunday for presidential and parliamentary elections. President Umaro Sissoco Embalo, a 53-year-old former army general seeking a second term, is backed by a political coalition of more than 20 groups, but the main opposition party has been barred from running.
items.content: Bissau-Guineans head to the polls on Sunday for presidential and parliamentary elections. President Umaro Sissoco Embalo, a 53-year-old former army general seeking a second term, is backed by a political coalition of more than 20 groups, but the main opposition party has been barred from running.

ai_summary: Guinea-Bissau is holding a presidential election.
The current president seeks a second term.
A relatively unknown candidate is challenging the president.
The main opposition party has been barred from running.
